title: 103_hr37
content: The Act titled "Social Security Earnings Test Amendments of 1993" eliminates the earnings test for individuals who have reached retirement age. The Social Security Act is amended to change the retirement age definition and earnings calculations for individuals above retirement age. The Social Security Act is amended to change the retirement age definition and earnings calculations for individuals above retirement age. The amendments include eliminating redundant references to retirement age and updating language to reflect the new definition. The Social Security Act is amended to change retirement age definitions and earnings calculations for individuals above retirement age. Amendments include adjustments to widow's or widower's insurance benefits entitlement and conforming amendments to provisions for determining delayed retirement increases. Amendments to the Social Security Act include changes to retirement age definitions, earnings calculations, widow's or widower's insurance benefits entitlement, and provisions for determining delayed retirement increases. Section 203(b) or 203(c) allows for benefits equal to the amount of such benefit. SEC. 3. INCREASE IN EXEMPT AMOUNT UNDER EARNINGS TEST FOR BENEFICIARIES UNDER RETIREMENT AGE. The Social Security Act is amended to increase the exempt amount for individuals under a taxable year ending after 1993 and before 1995 to $829.16 per month. Conforming amendments are made to various sections of the Act. The Social Security Act is amended to increase the exempt amount for individuals under a taxable year ending after 1993 and before 1995 to $829.16 per month. Amendments are made to paragraphs (8)(A) and (8)(B) regarding the new exempt amount. The Social Security Act is amended to increase the exempt amount for individuals under a taxable year ending after 1993 and before 1995. Amendments are made to various sections to reflect the new exempt amount. The amendments made by this Act will be effective for taxable years starting after December 31, 1993.
